headline.main: Artists Equity to Reopen a Gallery on the Lower East Side
headline.print_headline: Artists Equity Reopening a Gallery in Manhattan

docs.abstract: The New York Artists Equity Association has been without a gallery since 2011.
docs.snippet: The New York Artists Equity Association has been without a gallery since 2011.

docs.lead_paragraph: The ubiquitous handicapped symbol that marks parking spaces, building entrances and restrooms around the world is getting an update, a modernization that emphasizes ability rather than disability.

headline.main: Peppier Handicapped Symbol Gets Support, but Problems Remain
headline.print_headline: Peppier Handicapped Symbol Gets Support, but Problems Remain

docs.snippet: The ubiquitous handicapped symbol that marks parking spaces, building entrances and restrooms around the world is getting an update, a modernization that emphasizes ability rather than disability.

docs.lead_paragraph: After fleeing civil war, surviving a perilous sea crossing and trudging through several countries, Syrian refugees think they will receive basic food, shelter and fair treatment when they reach Austria. Most are right, but some tell a different tale.

headline.main: Migrants Fall Through the Cracks in Austria's Asylum System
headline.print_headline: Migrants Fall Through the Cracks in Austria's Asylum System

docs.snippet: After fleeing civil war, surviving a perilous sea crossing and trudging through several countries, Syrian refugees think they will receive basic food, shelter and fair treatment when they reach Austria. Most are right, but some tell a different tale.

docs.lead_paragraph: We don’t like ‘them.’ But we do like many of their ideas. At its best the system can run an army, and health care, and provide quality education.

headline.main: Guess Who Else Is a Socialist?

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of Americans covered through exchanges is expected to only inch up by the end of 2016 to 10 million, a much smaller number than earlier projections.

headline.main: Little Growth Predicted on Health Exchanges
headline.print_headline: Little Growth Predicted on Health Exchanges

docs.abstract: Obama administration predicts enrollment in public insurance marketplaces established by Affordable Care Act will not increase significantly by end of 2016; rise of 100,000 enrollees is expected, bringing total to 10 million people who have marketplace coverage.
docs.snippet: The number of Americans covered through exchanges is expected to only inch up by the end of 2016 to 10 million, a much smaller number than earlier projections.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Unless Congress acts, some beneficiaries will face premium increases of about 50 percent, the largest rise, by far, in the history of Medicare.

headline.main: No Social Security Raises Even if Medicare Soars
headline.print_headline: No Social Security Raises Even if Medicare Soars

docs.abstract: Obama administration says Social Security recipients will not receive cost-of-living increase in 2016, and warns that as a result about 30 percent of Medicare beneficiaries may experience record increase in premiums unless Congress acts to shield them from increase.
docs.snippet: Unless Congress acts, some beneficiaries will face premium increases of about 50 percent, the largest rise, by far, in the history of Medicare.

docs.lead_paragraph: UnitedHealth will jump into 11 more public insurance exchanges next year, as the nation's biggest health insurer grows more comfortable with one of the health care overhaul's main ways of expanding coverage to millions of people.

headline.main: UnitedHealth Dives Deeper Into Public Insurance Exchanges

docs.snippet: UnitedHealth will jump into 11 more public insurance exchanges next year, as the nation's biggest health insurer grows more comfortable with one of the health care overhaul's main ways of expanding coverage to millions of people.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. health officials said they expect 10 million people to be enrolled in healthcare plans through state-based insurance exchanges by the end of 2016, with more than one-quarter of eligible uninsured Americans signing up during this fall's open enrollment period.

docs.lead_paragraph: The health care law's historic gains in coverage may be leveling off: The Obama administration announced Thursday it expects only a slight overall increase in enrollment next year.

headline.main: Is Obama's Health Overhaul Losing Steam?
headline.print_headline: Is Obama's Health Overhaul Losing Steam?

docs.snippet: The health care law's historic gains in coverage may be leveling off: The Obama administration announced Thursday it expects only a slight overall increase in enrollment next year.

docs.lead_paragraph: Valeant Pharmaceuticals, one of the drugmakers in the eye of the storm over rising prescription medicine prices, says two federal prosecutors have subpoenaed documents on its drug pricing and other policies.
